data.title: Working At Lane College: Company Overview and Culture
data.meta_description: Learn about working at Lane College from employee reviews and detailed data on culture, salaries, demographics, management, financial, and more.
data.text:
Lane College overview

Industry

Education

Revenue

Headquarters

Employees

195

Founded In

Website

Organization Type

Education

When talking about Lane College, one must discuss its history. Located in Jackson, Tennessee, Lane was first established to educate newly-freed slaves and was a great contributor to literacy among African Americans in the South. Lane is, therefore, built on a foundation of strong commitment and service to its students on the part of faculty and staff. Lane offers bachelor's degrees in such fields as Criminal Justice, English, Religion, Business and Engineering. There is also a teacher-education program for those who wish to teach at the elementary, middle school or high school levels. Regardless of which degree or program you choose, you can be assured that you will receive the high level of commitment on the part of professors that is particular to Lane. Student support programs at Lane College also help you to succeed. Features include a crop of academic learning centers where students may receive tutoring and extra instruction in math, writing and other subjects. Financial aid counselors at Lane are helpful and will do their best to make sure you receive the necessary amount of aid, whether it's in the form of loans, grants, work-study, scholarships or some combination thereof.

Lane College has been around for a long time. It was founded back in 1882. This established organization loves to hire graduates from Lane College, with 67.4% of its employees having attended Lane College. Lane College is a great place to work and is featured as number 12 on Zippia's list of Best Companies to Work for in Jackson, TN.The average employee at Lane College makes $34,782 per year. Pay at Lane College is significantly lower than some of its highest paying competitors, like The City University of New York, Emerson College, and Carson-Newman University, which pay $58,869, $58,503, and $53,060, respectively.

Based in Tennessee, Lane College is a small education organization with only 195 employees and an annual revenue of $50.0M.
